title: upload more than quota limit when it is reached
body:
tested with daily stable 45 on a centos server.

after some tests to figure out that all is working fine, i found a bug that i think is caused by the path variable, but can't reach the problem!!

reproduction:

- when almost reached (or just reached) the quota limit, that limit goes mad and changes to the physic size of the server disk space.
- then can upload only one more file, don't amtter his size, it is uploaded and exceeds the limit.
- after that file is uploaded the quota is set again to the fine limit, but it's exceeded.
- can't upoad any file until deleting files.

expected behaviour: the user is unable to upload if the quota is exceeded or reached.

note: i observed that the quota limits the maximum filesize that i can upload, and gives a nice warning if you try to upload a file larger than your quota limit. that part works. it's only caused when the quota limit is reached.

that's the sequence of the quota limit (before reach the limit, when reached (the quota gones mad, and after):

![selecci n_001](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2392630/236170/67bbccb4-87db-11e2-881a-e510c318c86e.png)
![selecci n_002](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2392630/236171/6ae3f632-87db-11e2-825f-5e7df97ac69c.png)
